She is a decent lecturer, though her solutions may not always fully clear up confusion. Also, students should expect quick responses to emails and a willingness to help with problems.

Based on the comments it seems like Freshman students who take EE 241 succeed, while students in the EE 335 may face some challenges regarding understanding the lecture material.

Alexandria Bordas:
Based on the single available evaluation, Professor Bordas is described as a kind individual, but their teaching seems to be secondary to their professional journalism career. Students can expect classes to start late. There is a consistent issue with late grading, with no assignments graded by Week 5 of the quarter. Responsiveness to student emails appears to be lacking, hindering students' ability to get feedback or clarification. The small sample size makes it impossible to discern any trends in the grades of different years in college.
